text: [Music]
hey everybody thomas joseph here and
today i'm answering one of your
conundrums you've been asking me what
type of buttercream frosting do i like
to make and i'm gonna show you today the
perfect recipe and that is a Swiss
meringue buttercream now most often
times people use a basic buttercream
recipe which is what I have here it is
typically just butter and confectioner
sugar
and while it's tasty most times it's
really sweet and it's also very thick so
it doesn't spread evenly it doesn't
swoop when you're decorating cakes today
I'm gonna show you the Swiss meringue
buttercream which I have here it's super
soft and silky so you can frost cakes
like a professional and it's actually
almost just as easy as making a regular
basic buttercream so I'm gonna show you
how to do that today now the first part
of making a Swiss meringue buttercream
is making the meringue and that is egg
whites and sugar simple that's a
meringue so I have six egg whites here
and I'm going to put them into the bowl
of the stand mixer with one and a half
cups of granulated sugar
typically with meringues whether you're
making a French meringue a Swiss
meringue or an Italian meringue you need
twice as much sugar as you have egg
whites so I have six egg whites which is
about six ounces and one and a half cups
of sugar is 12 ounces so I have a pot of
simmering water here and I have my bowl
right over the top with this egg white
mixture together over the heat and what
its gonna do is it's gonna dissolve the
sugar into the egg whites and heat the
overall mixture so that it's safe to eat
with your whisk and I'm using the whisk
attachment to my stand mixer here just
make sure that you scrape down the sides
of the bowl so that any granules of
sugars that are along the side get mixed
in what I like to do is just dip my
finger in it
if you can heal any grains of sugar you
want to make sure you do that because if
they're not dissolved before you put it
on to the stand mixer
they will not dissolve and you'll end up
with a grainy crunchy frosting so now
this goes onto my stand mixer here and
I'm gonna start with the whisk
attachment and this goes on high speed
for about seven minutes until it's nice
and fluffy and it's almost quadrupled in
volume so our Swiss meringue has been
beating here for about seven minutes so
I'm gonna switch out my whisk attachment
to the paddle attachment here and now
add the butter and I have four sticks of
unsalted butter that are at room
temperature and that is going to go into
our wonderful egg white mixture here so
the great thing about a Swiss meringue
buttercream is the Swiss meringue adds
such a great lightness to the frosting
mixture itself so that really allows you
to swoop in coat cakes evenly and pipe
generous amounts of frosting on the
cupcakes when you add the butter you
want to wait a little bit until the
butter is incorporated before adding the
next tablespoon or so now most people
are very intimidated by a Swiss meringue
buttercream because they think that
their buttercream is gonna break but
there's a really easy way to bring back
your buttercream if that does happen
whether it's too loose you can bring it
back by cooling the mixture down while
you're whipping it or if it's too firm
heating up the side of the bowl while
you're whipping it and now for a little
bit of flavoring I'm gonna add some
vanilla extract here but you can use any
extract that you like orange is really
great a little bit of almond almond goes
a long way so be very careful about how
much you add peppermint is also really
great so our buttercream has become nice
and thick what we need to do right now
is we need to turn the mixer down to a
very low speed and what this does is it
knocks out all of the air bubbles within
the frosting so that you have something
that's really smooth and you'll have a
nice appearance for your cakes and for
your cupcakes whatever your decorating
the frosting is soft its silky it's
ready for decorating your cake I always
like to pipe Swiss meringue buttercream
frosting you want to make sure that
whenever you're filling a pastry bag
that you press all of the frosting into
the bag eliminating any air bubbles and
I have some chocolate cupcakes here but
again you can use this frosting on any
cake on any type of cupcakes wherever
you need frosting this is the one to go
to here and it pipes so easily I'm just
gonna do a tall amount of frosting there
and there you go a lighter smoother even
less sweet frosting that the
professionals use you have the recipe
now enjoy
[Music]
you
[Music]
